items.title: Champion of champions: Remembering Dr Charles Perkins 25 years after his death
items.summary: This weekend marks 25 years since the passing of Arrernte and Kalkadoon leader Dr Charles Perkins.

items.title: 'Irreparably broken': Barnaby Joyce to quit Nationals, won't contest seat at next election
items.summary: Reports the firebrand MP plans to defect to One Nation are not yet confirmed, but his options have been kept open.

items.title: 'Get the war over': Trump backs away from giving long-range missiles to Ukraine
items.summary: Zelenskyy came to Washington after weeks of calls for Tomahawk missiles, hoping to capitalise on Trump's growing frustration with Putin.

items.title: Prince Andrew renounces title amid renewed scrutiny over Epstein ties
items.summary: The move comes after new claims surfaced in Virginia Giuffre’s posthumous memoir detailing Andrew's alleged involvement with Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Former US politician George Santos to walk free after Trump commutes prison sentence
items.summary: Santos was jailed for seven years after pleading guilty to inflating fundraising figures and falsifying donor names to secure Republican financial support.

items.title: Remains of another Israeli hostage in Gaza handed over by Hamas
items.summary: Israel says it has received nine of 28 bodies held in Gaza, with Hamas saying it needed heavy machinery and excavating equipment to speed up the process.

items.title: The quiet creep that's making Australian banking less 'inclusive and accessible'
items.summary: A decline in face-to-face banking services and cash facilities is harming some Australians more than others, advocates say.

items.title: Hundreds of claims a day: Are these Australia's most dangerous jobs?
items.summary: More than 180 workers died from traumatic injuries while working in Australia last year, according to Safe Work Australia.

items.title: Australia’s rental affordability 'myth' that doesn’t match reality
items.summary: Workers in critical sectors are frequently locked out of affordable housing — and not just in capital cities, a new report says.

items.title: What this week's surprise unemployment data could mean for your mortgage repayments
items.summary: Australia's jobless rate has hit a near four-year high, raising speculation it could trigger another rate cut by the Reserve Bank.

items.title: 'Bombs have stopped, but threats remain': The 'absolute catastrophe' inside Gaza
items.summary: Humanitarian groups call for all Gaza crossings to open so more aid can enter, warning efforts depend on sustaining the fragile ceasefire.

items.title: KISS founding member and lead guitarist Ace Frehley dies at 74
items.summary: Ace Frehley, founding member of the glam rock band KISS, has died at 74 after complications following a recent fall.

items.title: Australian military 'contingency planning' for possible Gaza troop deployment
items.summary: A temporary international stabilisation force is a vital element of Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan for Gaza.

items.title: The great divide: Australians reach a 'difficult' new high
items.summary: Some say the numbers show life is getting harder, while others argue the picture isn’t as "dire" as it seems.

items.title: Embattled French prime minister survives no-confidence votes days after reappointment
items.summary: Sébastien Lecornu was reappointed prime minister last week, only four days after he resigned.

items.title: 'Degraded and uneasy': Incarcerated trans women push back on NT prison ban proposal
items.summary: Trans women prisoners are most at risk of violence, advocates say, hitting back at the NT chief minister's recent claims.

items.title: Government could make offshore skills change to solve 'wicked' problem
items.summary: Proposed tweaks to the skilled migration pathway could ensure migrants arrive job-ready.

items.title: Israel delays reopening of crucial Gaza border, rules out aid transfers
items.summary: A key border crossing between Gaza and Egypt will remain closed, dashing hopes it would quickly open under a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.

items.title: Army vehicle fleet grounded after soldier killed during training rollover in Queensland
items.summary: The soldier died after the M113 armoured personnel carrier he was travelling in rolled west of Townsville about 6.30pm on Wednesday.

items.title: NSW premier says court ruling striking out anti-protest laws 'disappointing'
items.summary: Critics said the police powers, implemented in February after alleged antisemitic attacks, were unconstitutional and too broad.

items.title: Australia's rainforests are now adding to carbon emissions, scientists say
items.summary: A new study has found Queensland's tropical rainforests emit more carbon than they absorb, raising concerns for Australia's climate targets.

items.title: Young people feel much more disconnected than boomers in Australia. Why?
items.summary: Social isolation and economic disadvantage are partly responsible for declining rates in national belonging, a new study suggests.

items.title: Hamas says it can't retrieve more bodies, as first hostage funerals start in Israel
items.summary: Israel confirmed it had received the coffins of two more deceased hostages and was transporting them to a facility for identification.

items.title: Racism is forcing more Indigenous people to leave the workforce
items.summary: Union leaders will convene in Melbourne to discuss the realities of institutional racism against Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander workers.
